BR_text.BRdescription:
When running ````!bentoml serve {saved_path}``` in the fastai example on google colab (<denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/github/bentoml/gallery/blob/master/fast-ai/salary-range-prediction/fast-ai-salary-range-prediction.ipynb>here</denchmark-link>
 ) I'm getting the following error:
 <denchmark-code>AttributeError: module 'fastai' has no attribute 'basic_train'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Any idea of how to solve this?

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sgaseretto>@sgaseretto</denchmark-link>
  thanks for reporting this issue, this is a regression introduced in the latest version of BentoML, will follow up with a fix soon

comments_1.comment_text:
The fix has been merged to master, feel free to install from master and try it out: pip install git+https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML.git, will update here again when it's released to PyPI.
 Thanks again <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sgaseretto>@sgaseretto</denchmark-link>
  for reporting this!

comments_2.comment_text:
Great <denchmark-link:https://github.com/parano>@parano</denchmark-link>
 , also thanks for the very quick response!

comments_3.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sgaseretto>@sgaseretto</denchmark-link>
  np! the fix is now in the latest release, just tested again on Google Colab and all the fastai notebooks work now! If you have already installed BentoML, you can upgrade with
